oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd Archive
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |a!kunta (Stoffel) (I)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The story of the Hottentot boy carried off by Baboons, as told by Sir J. Alexander, translated by la!kunta. (B I. 171-177.) Baboons steal a Koranna boy-child and take him to their place where he becomes wild. Some |xam see the child and tell the Koranna about it. The child is fetched and taken back to his kraal. 1) This story is found in Book I.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wilhelm Bleek notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Baboons take a child
